thread.title: Why are we still raising girls to avoid science?
thread.title_full: Video: Why are we still raising girls to avoid science? | Watch PBS NewsHour Online | PBS Video

author: pbs.org
title: Why are we still raising girls to avoid science?
text: Women in the U.S. receive less than 20 percent of Bachelor's degrees in computer science, engineering and physics. Eileen Pollack, one of the first two women to receive an undergraduate degree in physics at Yale, offers a solution to getting more women into science.
